STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 29, 2023
Carey Adrianse
WEXFORD/MISSAUKEE COUNTY DHHS
10641 W WATERGATE RD,
CADILLAC, MI, 49601-9424
RE: License#: CP830201508
Dear Ms. Adrianse:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is
required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must
include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Linda Tansil, Area Manager, at 248-860-0787.
Sincerely,
Douglas Turrill, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified
by another agency or tribe, the agency shall have a
record containing all of the following documents:
(f) Documentation that the foster parent has
received orientation to the policies of the borrowing
agency.
Three borrowed home files were reviewed. One of three files documented that the
foster parent received orientation to the agencies policies and procedures after
placement of the child. The child was placed on November 11, 2022 and the
parent received the orientation on December 2, 2022.
CPA Rule 400.12306 Application request
(4) An agency shall document that the licensee has
been given an application for renewal of the license
not less than 60 calendar days before the expiration
date of the license.

Three foster home files were reviewed. One of three documented that the home
license renewal was due February 27, 2023 and the application was sent to the
foster parent on January 18, 2023. The application was sent less than 60 days
prior to the renewal.
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
(1) An agency’s medical and dental care policy
shall, at a minimum, include all of the following:
(f) The provision of a dental examination and any
treatment required for each child who is 4 years of
age and older, including both of the following:
(i) A dental examination within 12 months
before placement or a new dental examination shall
be completed not more than 90 calendar days after
placement.
Six foster care files were reviewed. One of six documented that the child was
placed on July 18, 2022, and there was no dental exam in the file.
FOM 722-08D Treatment Plans
Once completed and approved, the caseworker must
obtain signatures from the following individuals, as
applicable.
• Caseworker. • Supervisor. • Second line supervisor,
when siblings in care are placed apart. • Parents who
are a member of a participating household. • Youth
ages 14 and older. • Foster parents, relative
caregivers, and unrelated court ordered caregivers
Six files and 17 service plans were reviewed. Eleven of 9 documented late
signatures or signatures were missing.
File # 1 A USP dated June 26, 2023, did not document signatures. A USP dated
March 28, 2023, did not documents signatures. A USP dated December 28,
2022, did not document signatures.
File # 2 A USP dated March 10, 2023, documented late signatures. The foster
parent signed the plan on Apriul 18, 2023 and the parent signed April 24, 2023.
File # 3. A USP dated May 11, 2023 was signed late by the parent on June 26,
2023 and signed late by the foster parent on June 28, 2023.
File # 4 A USP dated February 1, 2023, was signed late by the foster parent on
March 22, 2023.

File # 5. A USP dated April 28, 2023 documented signatures but was not
uploaded until August 21, 2023.
File # 6. A USP dated June 29, 2023, was not signed by the youth.
REPEAT VIOLATION:
11/21/22 Interim. CAP Approved 02/08/23
FOM 801-03 Medical Passport
For children entering foster care, the initial medical
passport must be provided within two weeks of the
child's placement date to the following: • Foster
care provider. • Young adult voluntary foster care
(YAVFC) youth/young adult re-entering foster care.
The actual date the medical passport is provided
must be documented in the electronic case
management record.
Six files and 18 medical passports were reviewed. Two of 18 pasasports did not
document that the foster care provider received the passport within two weeks of
the childs placement.
File # 1. The child was placed on October 11, 2022 and there was no signatures
indicating the provider received the passport.
File # 2. The file documented that the child was placed on November 28, 2022,
and signatures were lacking.
File #3. The file documented that the child was placed on October 5, 2022,
however the completed and signed passport was not uploaded until August 9,
2023.
REPEAT VIOLATION:
11/21/22 Interim. CAP Approved 02/08/23
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• Technical assistance was provided regarding FOM 722-06B Family Team
Meeting. In one file the agency was found to be uploading the DHS-1105
signature page but not the complete document. Recommended that the

agency upload the entire document so the consultant can review the content
of the FTM meeting.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or offered at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one corrective action plan during the period under
review. The CAP was approved on February 8, 2023, in response to violations
establised during in interim inspection completed on November 21, 2022. The
current inspection established two repeat violations.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators annual assessment was reviewed and found to be
thorough. The assessment addressed the agencies efforts to correct rule and
policy violations from the previous interim inspection. The assessment did not
identify any barriers to obtaining rule and policy compliance.
Financial Overview
The agency is a local DHHS office and financial records were not available for
review.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported feeling supported by their respective supervisors. Each
staff feel they are part of a well functioning and supportive team.
Youth were not interviewed by the consultant.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is a modern DHHS local office facility. It is spacious and well
maintained.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst identified two safety alerts during her visits to the homes. They are
as follows.

SAFETY ALERT #1, A safety alert was generated on April 18, 2023, and established
that the home did not have a carbon monoxide detector and there was not protocol to
prevent children from a water hazard. On April 21, 2023, a carbon monoxide detector
was installed and photos provided. The doors to the backyard are now locked and
door alarms installed. Resolution completed on April 21, 2023.
SAFETY ALERT #2. A safety alert was generated on April 25, 2023. The home has a
bedroom where the child sleeps and the bedroom window does not open from the
inside. The child was moved to another room until a contractor could complete
installation of a new window.
The CPA Analyst reported that families visited and interviewed stated that they are
satisfied with services provided and feel supported by the agency.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
August 29, 2023
_____________________________________
Douglas Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 6, 2023
